headline: Good experience, not overly challenging
pros: Lots of responsibility as a junior, your opinion is taken seriously when screening for initial targets.
cons: The company is very conservative in their investment choices meaning that lots of the work you do is immediately put aside as potential target screening is extremely strict.

headline: Good pay, but...
pros: I can only speak for the support staff, but the pay is decent, and if your supervisors like you and you do a good job, they treat you pretty well. Decent benefits and 401k.
cons: If, however, they don't like you (even if you slip up once in some cases), they will get rid of you unceremoniously!! Stressful environment, especially for exec assistants. Sometimes or often, depending on how lucky you get with who you're working for, your boss will make you do work (like do his kids' school projects - seriously??) on the weekends and after hours.

headline: Overall great company to work for
pros: Benefits, somewhat friendly environment, Great compensation
cons: Tense during busy times, and deal closings

headline: Great Company for Admin folks!
pros: Everyone shares in the profits of the company - bonuses based on company performance and personal performance.  Very rare in terms of administration employees!
cons: During deal closings it can get stressful.
